poem:
In Memory of Work

Isabelle,  
with strokes  
you wove words,  
spun learning,  
a loom of insight  
across nations.

Chairs unfilled,  
lectures echo  
Finland,  
Denmark -  
and the air stirs  
with whispers of  
what might have  
touched Singapore.

Words bound,  
unbreaking;  
your hands,  
still weaving.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Isabelle Szmigin obituary My wife, Isabelle Szmigin, who has died aged 68 after a series of strokes, was professor emerita of marketing at Birmingham University and an honorary professor at Henley Business School. She was dedicated to her work in education. Even in retirement she taught consumer behaviour on international MBA programmes in Finland and Denmark, with plans to do the same in Singapore. She also served as chair of the board of trustees for". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
